CChoiceControl

This class implements DropDownList, ComboBox and ListBox controls.

This control extends CControl.  All basic properties and functions are implemented and documented in this class.

Summary
CChoiceControlThis class implements DropDownList, ComboBox and ListBox controls.
Properties
SelectedItemThe text of the selected item.
SelectedIndexThe index of the selected item.
ItemsAn array containing all items.
Events
Introduction1) Use an event handler.
SelectionChanged(SelectedItem)Invoked when the selection was changed.
DoubleClick(Item)Invoked when an item in a ListBox is double-clicked.
CChoiceControl.CItemsAn array containing all items of the control.
Properties
1,2,3,4,...Individual items can be accessed by their index.
CountThe number of items in this control.
Functions
AddAdds an item at the end of the list.
ClearDeletes all items
DeleteDeletes an item of the list of choices.
MaxIndexReturns the number of items in this control.
CChoiceControl.CItems.CItemA single item of this control.
Functions
AddControlAdds a control to this item that will be visible only when this item is selected.
Properties
SelectedIf true, the item is selected.
TextThe text of the list item.

Properties

SelectedItem

The text of the selected item.

SelectedIndex

The index of the selected item.

Items

An array containing all items.  See CChoiceControl.CItems.

Events

Introduction

There are currently 3 methods to handle control events

1) Use an event handler.  Simply use control.EventName.Handler := “HandlingFunction” Instead of “HandlingFunction” it is also possible to pass a function reference or a Delegate: control.EventName.Handler := new Delegate(Object, “HandlingFunction”) If this method is used, the first parameter will contain the control object that sent this event.

2) Create a function with this naming scheme in your window class: ControlName_EventName(params)

3) Instead of using ControlName_EventName() you may also call CControl.RegisterEvent on a control instance to register a different event function name.  This method is deprecated since event handlers are more flexible.

The parameters depend on the event and there may not be params at all in some cases.

SelectionChanged(SelectedItem)

Invoked when the selection was changed.

DoubleClick(Item)

Invoked when an item in a ListBox is double-clicked.

CChoiceControl.CItems

An array containing all items of the control.

Summary
Properties
1,2,3,4,...Individual items can be accessed by their index.
CountThe number of items in this control.
Functions
AddAdds an item at the end of the list.
ClearDeletes all items
DeleteDeletes an item of the list of choices.
MaxIndexReturns the number of items in this control.

Properties

1,2,3,4,...

Individual items can be accessed by their index.

Count

The number of items in this control.

Functions

Add

Adds an item at the end of the list.

Parameters

TextThe text of the new item.
PositionThe position at which the item will be inserted.  Items with indices >= this value will be appended.
SelectSet to true to select the freshly added item.

Clear

Deletes all items

Delete

Deletes an item of the list of choices.

Parameters

IndexTextOrItemThe item which should be removed.  This can either be an index, the text of the item or the item object stored in the Items array.

MaxIndex

Returns the number of items in this control.

CChoiceControl.CItems.CItem

A single item of this control.

Summary
Functions
AddControlAdds a control to this item that will be visible only when this item is selected.
Properties
SelectedIf true, the item is selected.
TextThe text of the list item.

Functions

AddControl

Adds a control to this item that will be visible only when this item is selected.  The parameters correspond to the Add() function of CGUI.

Parameters

TypeThe type of the control.
NameThe name of the control.
OptionsOptions used for creating the control.
TextThe text of the control.
UseEnabledStateIf true, the control will be enabled/disabled instead of visible/hidden.

Properties

Selected

If true, the item is selected.

Text

The text of the list item.

Basic control class from which all controls extend.
An array containing all items of the control.
Attention!
